replies.msg:
https://www.wanghenry.com/2016/11/New-Line-Vpn-Japan-Sticker.html
1.確定 LINE帳號已綁定、且一定要開啟LINE 兩段式驗證(教學)，接著移除LINE。
2.Android裝置請關閉GPS、iOS去設定內把"區域"調整為"日本"
3.『手機關機』後移除SIM卡。【請關機後再手動開機、不要選"重新啟動"】
補充：有些廠牌手機在設定中會有快速啟動的設定(EX: HTC)，有此功能者請將此功能關閉!
4.Play商店 / App Store(台灣商店OK!)重新安裝LINE
5.完成LINE的安裝後，開始連線VPN到日本(其他國貼圖以此類推)
6.VPN狀態下打開LINE並且務必以FB帳號登入
登入後，看到LINE後台設定的多項服務都與台灣不同下，即確定跨區的動作大功告成囉!
補充：iOS (iPhone / iPad用戶) 請去『手機設定』-『語言與地區』將地區設定為日本!(如下圖)
跟呢度終於成功!
裝LINE及LINE MUSIC時不用開VPN

Model Press之後問佢有無曾經有想辭去工作的念頭
― 大学ではなく、仕事を辞めてしまいたい、と思ったことはないですか？

大原：それはないです。自分が大変という理由で辞めるのは、応援してくれる方々を裏切ることになるので、絶対にしたくない、できない！辛くて泣いちゃったことはありましたけど、お仕事を辞めるというのは考えたことないですね。

櫻子:無,因為覺得咁做背叛左支持佢的唔同人,所以絕對唔會,唔可以.
雖然有辛苦到不知覺喊出來的時候.但從來無諗過話辭去工作

replies.msg:
可能因為時間比較短未出碟，
個剪接好原始好正

I assigned five and a half hours for practising her songs on my guitar 🎸 She’s been strutting her stuff since she was a kid. Several years ago I saw her live at Tokyo Dome Stadium 🏟 which was absolutely incredible and unforgettable. At the end of the last encore, she bowed onstage soaking up the applause👏🏻 She received a thunderous standing ovation. Several years ago she took part in a five hundred metre race where she came third. She rose to the occasion, ran for all she was worth and dived over the finish line 🏁 passing the runner 🏃🏻‍♀️ who was ahead of her earlier. Lots of people celebrated with her and congratulated her on winning the race as she held the trophy 🏆 up. The race was the opportunity for all the world’s best runners 🏃🏻‍♀️ to strut their stuff. It was truly memorable. I like japan culture and food 🥘 Last year I took the JLPT at N two level in which I got a merit. My speaking outshines my reading 📖 so the marks I gained in speaking offset the marks I lost in reading 😊My friend Jess too took the test at N three level. She’s a little weak at listening but good at writing so the marks she lost in the listening section are offset by the marks she gained in the writing section. It’s a good bet that the yen 💴 will continue falling so you might as well go to japan for your holiday this year. I recommend climbing Mount Fuji. The extra cost of traveling there is offset by the falling admission charge so don’t worry. It’s worth a visit. It’s an arduous journey but it’s worth it for the view from the top. At night the nearby lakes reflects the beauty of the stars ✨ and Mount Fuji 🗻 giving a double view of the sky at night. I still remember I spilt a bowl of udon all over the table and the floor and on my shirt so I had to wipe up the spilled udon🤣Again, lower admission fee offsets the rising transportation fees. Even though you’re outside Tokyo I still recommend visiting Mount Fuji. Holidaying in Japan this summer is a safe bet because the yen has dropped significantly over the past eight weeks. I go to the annual winter carnival 🎡 every Christmas 🎄 I enjoy riding the thrill rides and eating pancakes 🥞 and sushi 🍣 soaking up the nice Christmassy atmosphere. Whether it’s summer or winter Japan is always a great place to relax. Apparently the sunlight has been dazzling, you might just as well have a good long soak in an outdoor onsen soaking up the sun 🌞

紅唔紅除咗實力，亦需要運氣，好多人浮浮沉沉多年，一個機會就翻身。

2020年開催ファンクラブ会員限定 櫻子バースデーイベントのチケット2次受付が決定！
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
2020年1月に東京・大阪で開催される、ファンクラブ会員限定の櫻子バースデーイベント
「ファンクらこパーティー」のチケット2次受付が決定いたしました！

【チケット2次受付】
■申込受付期間：
10月12日（土）12:00～10月23日（水）23:59

■当落発表日：
11月2日（土）12:00

■当選者入金期間：
11月2日（土）12:00～11月5日（火）23:59

※「さくらぶ」と「さくもば」同時受付
※1次受付にてすでにご当選されている公演がある会員さまは、同一公演にお申込みいただきましても、無効となります。
※2次受付は、いずれの公演も、1次受付当選後の未入金によるキャンセル分を若干数受付するものとなります。
抽選となる可能性が高くなっておりますので、ご理解いただいた上でお申込みをお願いいたします。


【公演概要】
大原櫻子ファンクラブ会員限定バースデーイベント2020
ファンクらこパーティー

＜東京公演＞2020年1月8日（水） Zepp Tokyo
昼の部　14:00 open / 15:00 start
夜の部　18:00 open / 19:00 start

＜大阪公演＞2020年1月10日（金） Zepp Namba
昼の部　13:00 open / 14:00 start
夜の部　17:00 open / 18:00 start

■チケット料金
全席指定　3,900円＋税（ドリンク代別途）

■ご入場時のご本人さま確認に関して

LUX Luminique 洗頭水，店頭海報：

I saw her concert recently which was absolutely incredible and unforgettable. She and the dancers and acrobats which she invited gave a superb performance. The choreography, lighting, glow sticks and the stage design were marvelous. It was beyond my expectation. Yesterday I assigned four hours for practicing her songs on my piccolo, flute, oboe, cor anglais (english horn), clarinet, E-flat clarinet, bass clarinet, bassoon and contrabassoon. I practised with my friends who play triangle, tambourine, castanets, gongs, sleigh bells (jingle bells), cymbals (hi-hat, clash and ride), snare drum and bass drum, all of which have indefinite pitch. Oboe, cor anglais and bassoon are double-reed instruments whereas clarinet and saxophone are single-reed instruments. Flute is a reedless instrument.

replies.msg: 巴打就好啦
有冇邊度有新歌聽下？

I saw her live twice at Yokohama Arena which was absolutely incredible and unforgettable. The first time i saw her concert we were late. i remember i said "look at the time. The concert will have started." It was quarter past eight. The concert would've started by then. At the end of the last encore she bowed onstage soaking up the applause. She met with a thunderous ovation. It was a worthwhile concert that was compelling enough to see again. The singer and the dancers and acrobats who were invited to perform alongside her gave a magnificent performance. The choreography, stage and lighting design and the glow sticks were superb and.surpassed our expectations. The singer is very career-oriented. My brother whos also very career-minded is planning on having her endorse his company's products but he'll have to make it financially worthwhile for her. She has a worthwhile job and career because I consider music performing to be a worthwhile career. Yesterday I assigned five hours for practising her songs on my saxophone, piccolo, flute, onoe, cor anglais (english horn), clarinet, E-flat clarinet, bass clarinet, bassoon and contrabassoon. I practised with my friends who played glockenspiel, xylophone, vibraphone, marimba, timpani (kettle-drum), chimes and celesta, all of which have definite pitch. Saxophone, cor anglais and clarinet are transposing instruments. Saxophone, clarinet and bass clarinet are single reed instruments while one, cor anglais, bassoon and contrabassoon are double reed instruments. Flute is a reedless instrument. My friend Charles is a trumpeter. He explained to us regarding a piece by Haydn "this passage should be played beautifully rather than rhythmically. Otherwise it's a bit cheap." I saw lots of his pencil marks on the score such as: cantabile, silence, no pause here, just separate, clean pedal, more melodic voicing, remain soft, stay soft, quiet, hear tenor, clearer, articulate, in time, silvery soft, gentler, take time....Regarding teaching he said "I prefer payment in blocks. My students pay monthly or for four lessons at a time. For this month, it's ok to pay on a lesson-by-lesson basis because maybe you wanna see what it's like to have lessons. From next month onwards you can pay monthly. Students of all standards are welcome. I'm also an accompanist who accompanies instrumentalists, singers, dancers and other performers for exams, auditions and live performances. Some of my adult students started learning the trumpet when they were eighteen years old. Their fingers are less dextrous and slower than say a twelve year old kid. Start training your fingers when you're still very young so that you can get much faster fingers. It'll improve your finger speed, accuracy, strength and dexterity to a great extent." He asked me to get him some Ravel scores as I can get them on the cheap from a friend of mine.
